node.title: Courts to operate under transitonal Covid-19 protocols until end of January
node.description: The country's courts need more time to set up the infrastructure to operate under the traffic light system.

node.title: Preliminary designs revealed for Christchurch stadium
node.description: Christchurch City Council has revealed four preliminary design images for the long-awaited 30,000 seat Canterbury Multi-Use Arena.

node.title: Biden blasted for reviving Trump's 'Remain in Mexico' policy
node.description: US President Joe Biden has come under fire for restoring a Trump-era policy that requires asylum seekers to wait in Mexico while their claims are processed.

node.title: 'Getting 90 percent of NZers to agree on anything is highly unusual' - deputy PM
node.description: The Deputy Prime Minister has hit back at claims that NZ is a divided nation over vaccinations, saying the numbers "simply do not bear that out". Watch the government's latest Covid-19 briefing here.

node.title: CDL Land planning residential development on 70ha in Havelock North
node.description: The company obtained Overseas Investment Office approval to buy the 69.4 hectares of land from the Lowe family, earlier this month, for an undisclosed price.

node.title: WHO expects to have more information on Omicron 'within days'
node.description: The World Health Organisation expects to have more information on the transmissibility of the new Omicron variant of the coronavirus within days, its technical lead on Covid-19 says.

node.title: Was She Just Another Nicely Packaged Pain Delivery System?
node.description: I had been burned too badly to believe in love. And yet, believe I did.

node.title: Holiday Gift Books for Children
node.description: From a little suitcase that contains a towering cake to the ultimate shaggy dog story.

node.title: The 25 Best Children’s Books of 2021
node.description: The most notable picture, middle grade and young adult books of the year, selected by The Times’s children’s books editor.

node.title: The Best Movies and TV Shows New to Netflix, Amazon and Stan in Australia in December
node.description: Our picks for December, Including ‘The Power of the Dog,’ ‘Don’t Look Up’ and ‘The Lost Daughter’

node.title: Nevada Sets Up Surcharge For Unvaccinated State Workers Who Need to Be Routinely Tested
node.description: On Thursday, the state Public Employees' Benefit Program Board voted to charge unvaccinated workers up to $55 per month. It will go into effect July 2022.

node.title: Police Identify 17-year-old as Murder Victim in 41-Year-Old Case, Say Investigation Is Active
node.description: Police in Nevada said Thursday the identity of a 1980 murder victim was confirmed through new DNA testing, and are reopening the investigation into her death.

node.title: An AI spy plane is already flying over Australia — but there are questions to answer
node.description: While military aircraft with innovative technologies are designed to fight wars, they also need to exist safely in our communities.

node.title: Skills shortages top challenge facing company bosses - survey
node.description: Ongoing supply chain disruptions are also among the key challenges creating headaches for company directors.

node.title: Covid-19: Ninety percent of eligible population in Auckland now fully vaccinated
node.description: Ninety percent of the eligible population across Tāmaki Makaurau are now fully vaccinated, health authorities have confirmed.

node.title: DA Says Overwhelmed Assistant Set Low Bail That Darrell Brooks Jr. Paid Before Parade Carnage
node.description: District Attorney John Chisholm said an overworked assistant prosecutor set the $1,000 bail Brooks paid days before allegedly driving into a Christmas parade.

node.title: 'I thought it was a prank': Perth gym buddies win record $80 million Powerball jackpot
node.description: A Perth gym is filled with the sound of screaming and champagne corks popping as a group of women claim WA's largest-ever division one lotto win.

node.title: Inexperienced Phoenix excited about A-League debut
node.description: The Phoenix will debut in Australia's national women's football competition tonight with plenty of enthusiasm but very little experience.

node.title: Former Nurse Who Sexually Assaulted, Impregnated Incapacitated Woman Gets 10-Year Sentence
node.description: "To the victim, I am sorry," Nathan Sutherland said. "You didn't deserve to be hurt no matter what was going on in my personal life."

node.title: James Hayward resigns from WA Nationals amid child sex charges
node.description: Accused child sex offender James Hayward resigns from the WA Nationals, but is yet to reveal whether he will stand down as a member of the Parliament of Western Australia

node.title: What we know about the Michigan school shooting victims
node.description: The four victims killed in a Michigan school shooting included athletes and artists looking forward to the future.

node.title: 60 Michigan Schools Close Following Oxford Copycat Threats
node.description: "It's overrunning our resources to investigate these false threats," said the Oakland County sheriff.

node.title: NYC Mayor de Blasio Extends Vaccine Mandate To Include Staff at Private, Religious Schools
node.description: While questions remain about how the mandate will be enforced at private schools, about 56,000 employees will have to prove at least one dose by Dec. 20.

node.title: Rural children with developmental issues at higher risk of going to jail, health inquiry hears
node.description: The NSW health inquiry hears children face life-long problems and sometimes jail time due to a lack of early intervention services in remote and rural NSW.

node.title: Regulators in US, UK, EU All Alarmed By Chip Maker Nvidia's $40B Deal to Buy Chip Designer
node.description: The Federal Trade Commission claimed that the deal would give Nvidia control over technology that other companies need to manufacture their own chips.

node.title: NSW patients ostracised, 'frog-marched' out of Queensland hospitals, doctor says
node.description: Baby Esther needs regular care at a major Queensland hospital — but because she lives in northern NSW, COVID policies are making those visits "very distressing", her mum says.

node.title: Supplies of toilet paper no problem, timber pallets to transport them another story
node.description: A shortage of Victorian-made wooden pallets threatens supermarket supplies ahead of Christmas and for years come, say timber mills, CFMEU and Food and Grocery Council.

node.title: NSW patients 'treated like lepers', 'frog-marched' out of Queensland hospitals, doctor says
node.description: Baby Esther needs regular care at a major Queensland hospital — but because she lives in northern NSW, COVID policies are making those visits "very distressing", her mum says.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 92 new community cases in New Zealand today
node.description: There are 92 new community cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today.

node.title: Alec Baldwin describes "Rust" shooting in emotional interview
node.description: "Someone is responsible for what happened and I can't say who that is, but I know it's not me," Baldwin said.
